subject: Re: [junit] Running tests in a logical flow..

messageBody:
Arun J wrote:
>
> Folks,
>
> I am trying to do the following two things..
>
> #1. I have multiple related tests and I am trying to execute them in a
> logical flow. say
> Test1.run();
> if(Test1_result.wasSuccessful()){
> Test2.run();
> if(Test2_result.wasSuccessful()){
> Test3.run();
> Test4.run();
> if(Test4_result.wasSuccessful()){
> Test5.run();
> }
> }
> }

If you really need this, look at TestNG.

If you really want to write good, focused, object-level tests that drive
a clean, object-oriented design, then you need to change your code so
that you /don't/ need tests to depend on eac other.

> #2. I wanted to call these test programmatically as mentioned above.
> So I would like to give my own test name that are not starting with
> test. Since jUnit tester will pick up testXXX irrespective.
>
> How to go about doing this? Have anyone encountered problem of this kind.

You need to write your own test runner. The JUnit test runners assume
that the test suite is built before the first test runs.
